com.tightdb
Class TableQuery<T extends Row>

java.lang.Object
  com.tightdb.TableQuery<T>
Type Parameters:
T - 
public class TableQuery<T extends Row>
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a Query that is attached to a particular table. A query is applied to a table to filter some of the rows in turn be applied to get a view of the table. A view is a read only table by which we can access M number of rows from the table. In our case M <= N (less than or equal to N) where N is the number of rows of the table. A view can be think a read only access to a table with some filters applied. To apply a filter to a view we use the query object. we can apply a fiter for a particular value [lower bound, higher bound, or equals] against a column.

Author:
anirban

Method Detail

equals

public TableQuery<T> equals(java.lang.String colname,
                            java.lang.Object value)
Adds a equality query as a filter. When we execute the query, value of each row of this particular column is checked for equality. If the condition is satisfied the particular column is included into the view.

Parameters:
colname -
value -
Returns:

notEquals

public TableQuery<T> notEquals(java.lang.String colname,
                               java.lang.Object value)
Adds a not equality filter. This filter is for each row of the table against the particular column. If the value of the cell is not equal to the value that row is included into the view.

Parameters:
colname -
value -
Returns:

public TableQuery<T> greaterThan(java.lang.String columnName,

Applies a greater than filter. The filter has a relevance if the greater than operation is relevant to the datatype of the column of the table applied to this query.

Applied a greater than or equal to filter to the query. This filter has a relevance if the greater than or equal to operation has a relevance to the datatype of the table represented by the columnname.

between

public TableQuery<T> between(java.lang.String columnName,
                             java.lang.Object value1,
                             java.lang.Object value2)
Applies a between filter to the query. The rows which cell values of this column are included into the view if the value of that cell falls between value1 and value2.

Parameters:

value1 -

group

public TableQuery<T> group()
A collection filters can be grouped for execution purpose. As the filters of the TableQuery is applied in a Fluent Interface manner sometimes it is necessary to apply a precedence against two filters. For this purpose we apply group which can be thought as a parentheses. Our group creates a left parentheses into the query.

Returns:

endGroup

public TableQuery<T> endGroup()
Marks a end of the group for a collection of filetrs.

Returns:
